content:
The artists I mentioned were not necessarily chosen specifically for the Pollock-Krasner grant; rather, they are some examples of notable artists who have at some point received the grant. The grant is open to all artists who meet the eligibility criteria outlined on the Pollock-Krasner Foundation website, regardless of their level of fame or recognition.

That being said, the Pollock-Krasner grant is highly competitive and is only awarded to artists who demonstrate artistic merit and financial need. The selection committee reviews each application on the basis of the artist's work, exhibition history, and impact in their field, and the grant is intended to support artists who are making significant contributions to contemporary art.

The Pollock-Krasner Foundation does not specifically prioritize any particular style, medium, or genre of art, and the grant has been awarded to artists working in a wide range of disciplines, including painting, sculpture, printmaking, photography, and multimedia.

Ultimately, the foundation's goal is to support individual artists and help them to pursue their artistic practice in as sustainable and meaningful a way as possible. The choice of artists to receive the grant is based on their talent, dedication, and potential to make a meaningful impact in the world of contemporary art.
